passages.text: Ather, on 30 August 2025, unveiled EL, its next- generation scooter platform, along with AtherStack 7.0, the Redux concept, Infinite Cruise, a new 6 kW fast- charger generation, and OTA updates for the Rizta range, alongside Halo helmet updates and expanded vehicle security/remote- control features at the third edition of its Ather Community Day 2025.

The EL platform marks Ather's first new vehicle architecture since the Ather 450. The platform introduces a new chassis, powertrain and electronics stack, while its simplified design reduces component count to enable \(15\%\) faster assembly and up to 2x faster servicing, extending service intervals to \(10\mathrm{km}\) with manufacturing for new models (first in the festival season of 2026) to be carried out at Ather's new Aurangabad (Chhatrapati Sambhajinagar) facility. The EL platform supports multiple form factors and battery packs ranging from \(2.2 - 5.0\mathrm{kWh}\) . Safety and convenience have also been enhanced through the Advanced Electronic Braking System (AEBS), which shortens braking distances and prevents rear- wheel lockups. Alongside EL, Ather presented Redux, a futuristic motoscooter concept blending scooter nimbleness with motorcycle- like dynamics.

The company also announced AtherStack 7.0, its most significant software update to date, introducing natural- language voice interaction powered by a proprietary LLM trained for Indian dialects. Stack 7.0 delivers proactive features, such as Pothole Alerts, Crash Alerts with emergency contact notifications, and an expanded theft- safety suite with ParkSafe and LockSafe. The update will roll out OTA to its existing Rizta Z and 450X Gen 3 scooters. Complementing the upgrade, Ather has refreshed the Halo smart helmet with safety enhancements (anti- fog visor, emergency padding, USB- C charging, noise- reduction audio).

Ather further launched Infinite Cruise, its advanced cruise control system tailored for Indian conditions, debuting on the 2025 450 Apex. Infinite Cruise incorporates three distinct modes: CityCruise, Hill Control, and Crawl Control. On the infrastructure front, Ather unveiled its new 6 kW fast chargers, which are half the size of current units and deliver 2x the charging speed, adding \(\sim 30\mathrm{km}\) range in 10 minutes. Meanwhile, the Rizta Z has received a major OTA upgrade that activates touchscreen functionality, introduces a new Eco Mode and adds a Terracotta Red colour option.

Our view: With the EL platform reveal, we believe Ather continues to strengthen its position as a technology and innovation leader in the electric two- wheelers space, highlighting its focus on enhancing the overall rider experience. Additionally, the success of the next- gen fast- charging rollout and the timely commissioning of the Aurangabad facility will determine how quickly Ather can ramp production and maintain its competitive edge in the ecosystem.

We estimate overall EV penetration to rise from \(6\%\) in FY25 to \(19\%\) by FY30F. We believe Ather is a key play on the significant growth potential of EVs. We estimate its volumes to rise at a CAGR of \(\sim 41\%\) over FY25- 28F, from 155k units in FY25 to 436k units in FY28F. This will be backed by the doubling of its stores from \(\sim 350\) (March- 25), launch of the "EL" platform in FY27, and the "Zenith" motorcycle platform down the line. Our TP of INR458 is derived using \(\sim 3.3x\) EV/sales based on average FY27- 28F sales. On EV/sales, Ather currently trades at \(2.6x\) FY28F, in line with high- growth peers. We maintain Buy.

Ather Energy (ATHERENE IN)INR 450 (29-Aug-2025) Buy (Sector rating: N/A)Rating and target price chart (three year history)Ather EnergyAs of 30-Aug-2025Currency = INRDate30-Jul-25RatingBuyTarget price346.00450.00400.00350.00300.00250.00200.00150.00100.0050.000.002023/01/012023/07/012024/01/012024/07/012025/01/012025/07/01Closing PriceTarget Price ChangeRecommendation Changes
For explanation of ratings refer to the stock rating keys located after chart(s)

Valuation Methodology We believe Ather is well positioned to emerge as the fastest- growing 2W company in our coverage in the medium term. This will be driven by rising EV mix, new products and effective execution of its premiumization strategy. We expect the future products to ramp up faster as its distribution network would already be ramped up by then. Further, economies of scale, falling battery costs and value engineering should continue to drive up margins. We arrive at a TP of INR458 based on an EV/sales multiple of 3.3x average of FY27- 28F sales. Its current valuation at 2.8x FY27F EV/Sales is in line with peers like TVS, which we find attractive given that its revenue growth is likely to remain much faster than peers over the next decade. The benchmark index for the stock is Nifty 50.

Risks that may impede the achievement of the target price Downside risks: Competitive intensity: Ather faces stiff rivalry from Ola, TVS, Bajaj and Hero etc. Increased demand traction of traditional players may dilute its market share and affect growth. Regulatory and subsidy volatility: Ather benefits from PM E- drive on almost all of its scooter. If the same is discontinued could erode margins. Rare earth magnet supply constraint: Ather may face issues in procuring rare earth elements needed for its motor and hence affect production and also affect margins.

A rating of 'Buy', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to outperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Neutral', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to perform in line with the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Reduce', indicates that the analyst expects the stock to underperform the Benchmark over the next 12 months. A rating of 'Suspended', indicates that the rating, target price and estimates have been suspended temporarily to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies. Securities and/or companies that are labelled as 'Not rated' or shown as 'No rating' are not in regular research coverage. A 'Bullish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to outperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Neutral' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to perform in line with the Benchmark during the next 12 months. A 'Bearish' stance, indicates that the analyst expects the sector to underperform the Benchmark during the next 12 months. Sectors that are labelled as 'Not rated' or shown as 'N/A' are not assigned ratings. Benchmarks are as follows: United States: S&P 500; Europe: Dow Jones STOXX 600; Global Emerging Markets (ex- Asia): MSCI Emerging Markets ex- Asia. Japan/Asia ex- Japan: Sector ratings are not assigned.

A Target Price, if discussed, indicates the analyst's forecast for the share price with a 12- month time horizon, reflecting in part the analyst's estimates for the company's earnings. The achievement of any target price may be impeded by general market and macroeconomic trends, and by other risks related to the company or the market, and may not occur if the company's earnings differ from estimates.
